us.title: Starknet to settle on Bitcoin and Ethereum to unify the chains
us.content: Ethereum layer 2 Starknet is laying the groundwork to settle on Bitcoin and Ethereum to unify the two largest blockchains on a single layer.The Starknet Foundation said in its March 11 Bitcoin roadmap that it's aiming for Starknet to become Bitcoin's execution layer, scaling it from 13 transactions per second to thousands, reducing blocks and gas fees, and creating a better user experience. “Most Bitcoin today sits static in wallets and exchanges, constrained by the limitations of the network's original design: a lack of scalability and an inability to natively support applications beyond simple buying, selling, and transferring,” the foundation said.

us.title: Lone Bitcoin miner wins block using tiny, cheap rig — ‘1 in a million chance'
us.content: A solo Bitcoin miner using a relatively cheap, pocket-sized crypto mining rig has solved one of the blockchain's blocks and earned the full $263,000 reward.The miner became the 297th solo miner to mine a Bitcoin block from the solo.ckpool Bitcoin (BTC) mining pool, its developer, Con Kolivas, said in a March 10 X post. He added the miner used a 480-gigahash per second (GH/s) Bitaxe machine.

us.title: Bitcoin Mining Momentum: Eric Trump, Metaplanet, and BTC Bull Token in Focus
us.content: Bitcoin is back in the spotlight – and not just because of the price charts. In the latest twist of crypto-meets-mainstream, Eric Trump has officially stepped into the Bitcoin mining game.

us.title: Bitcoin Accumulation Trend Rises As Whale And Shark Investors Go On A Buying Spree
us.content: The current bearish state of the overall crypto market has triggered fears of a bear market since Bitcoin, the largest digital asset, continues to decline, reaching as low as $77,760. It is worth noting that BTC has been decreasing from its new all-time high of $109,000.

us.title: Massive Bitcoin whale buys $200M in BTC, another wakes up after 8 years
us.content: A massive Bitcoin whale wallet holding has just added $200 million worth of Bitcoin to its position after selling over 11,400 Bitcoin over the last few months — coinciding with a recent rebound for the original cryptocurrency. The Bitcoin (BTC) whale added 2,400 Bitcoin — worth over $200 million — to their stash on March 24, blockchain analytics firm Arkham Intelligence said in an X post.

us.title: Bitcoin Staking Protocol Babylon Reveals BABY Token Airdrop
us.content: Babylon's BABY token will be airdropped to Bitcoin stakers and other groups with the launch of the Babylon Genesis network.

us.title: Donald Trump's Tariffs, Bitcoin, And The Crypto Market: Everything You Should Know About Why The Market Crashed
us.content: Bitcoin, along with the entire crypto market, was sent into another brief disarray in the past few hours after a new wave of bearish sentiment hit through, causing all large-market cap cryptos to bleed red.

us.title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says corrections are 'healthy' and 'normal.' Jim Cramer disagrees
us.content: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Monday parsed recent market action, saying the reason the S&P 500 plummeted into correction territory last week is not typical. "Right now, people are worried about a recession that's caused by the President of the United States," he said.

us.title: U.S. households are running out of emergency funds as pandemic cash runs out, inflation takes its toll
us.content: The latest survey from the New York Federal Reserve shows just 62.7% of Americans can come up with $2,000 for an emergency.

us.title: Fed's Barkin: Auto firms under tariffs will face tough choices on pricing, margins
us.content: Richmond Federal Reserve President Tom Barkin said he did not expect consumers to face the full brunt of the 25% tax the Trump administration has set on imported cars, but added firms will have difficult choices ahead on pricing and profit margins.

france.title: French antitrust regulator fines Apple 150 million euros over privacy tool
france.content: France's antitrust regulator on Monday fined Apple 150 million euros ($162.36 million) for abusing its dominant position in mobile app advertising on iOS and iPadOS devices between 2021 and 2023 via a privacy control tool called ATT.

france.title: Apple Fined $162 Million in France Over App Tracking Transparency
france.content: France's competition regulator fined Apple over concerns the company abused its dominant position in mobile apps through its iPhone and iPad's operating system.

france.title: France's antitrust watchdog fines Apple for problems with App Tracking Transparency
france.content: France's antitrust watchdog fined Apple 150 million euros ($162 million) on Monday over a privacy feature protecting users from apps snooping on them because its introduction resulted in abuse of competition law.

france.title: France Fines Apple $162 Million, Alleging Privacy Tool Violated Competition Law
france.content: France's competition regulator has fined Apple 150 million euros (about $162 million), alleging that the company's App Tracking Transparency (ATT) made the use of third-party applications in the iOS environment “excessively complex.

uk.title: Boeing, Apple, GE to join US business mission to Vietnam next week, list shows
uk.content: Top U.S. tech, defence and energy companies including Boeing and Apple will join a large business mission to Vietnam next week, a list of participants seen by Reuters shows, in a possible sign of confidence as the Southeast Asian country seeks to avoid U.S. trade tariffs.

uk.title: Court hearing reported to be Apple's appeal against UK order held in secret
uk.content: A London court hearing, reported to be Apple's appeal against a British government order to create a "back door" to its encrypted cloud storage systems, was held in secret on Friday, with media not allowed to attend despite a formal request.

uk.title: March BoE Meeting: Balancing Inflation And Growth Risks
uk.content: The Bank of England kept its policy rate at 4.5% in March, with an 8 to 1 vote, signaling a cautious approach to monetary easing. Inflation remains a key concern, with recent data showing higher-than-expected CPI and core inflation, complicating the BoE's disinflation efforts.

uk.title: Mag 7 Trades: MSFT, AAPL Move Past "Drag 7"
uk.content: Alex Coffey is back for Daily Trader from @CboeGlobalMarkets. He's got his eyes on a pair of example options trades in Microsoft (MSFT) and Apple (AAPL).

germany.title: March 2025 in charts: Trump trade war hits Bitcoin, $22M in DeFi hacks
germany.content: March was a rough month for markets — US President Donald Trump's uncertain tariff policies created volatility in Bitcoin and crypto markets; meanwhile, decentralized finance (DeFi) struggled with security concerns.Retaliatory tariffs on US goods in China and the European Union hit markets on March 10 and 12, respectively. Amid the tête-à-tête between the United States and its largest trade partners, Bitcoin managed to recover on March 24 to $88,0000 before slumping down again to around $82,000 at the time of writing.

germany.title: BlackRock Launches Bitcoin Fund in Europe Following Roaring IBIT Success
germany.content: BlackRock's latest Bitcoin fund will tap Coinbase for custody with each ETP security corresponding to a specific amount of the digital asset.

germany.title: U.S. tariffs could thrust Germany into recession, central bank governor says
germany.content: Ongoing U.S. tariffs could push Europe's largest economy into a recession, German central bank President Joachim Nagel warned. "Now we are in a world with tariffs, so we could expect maybe a recession for this year, if the tariffs are really coming," he said during a BBC podcast interview.

germany.title: Apple shares drop 7% in Frankfurt after Trump tariffs on China
germany.content: Apple shares fell 7% in Frankfurt after U.S. President Donald Trump announced sweeping tariffs on trading partners including China where the U.S. group has a big manufacturing base.

germany.title: Apple loses German antitrust appeal, opening door for greater controls
germany.content: Apple lost an appeal on Tuesday against a regulatory assessment that opens the iPhone maker up to stricter controls in Germany, the Federal Court of Justice ruled on Tuesday, following years of debate over the company's market position.

germany.title: Euro zone inflation dips to 2.2% in March as U.S. tariffs loom
germany.content: It comes after recent preliminary data showed that inflation came in lower than forecast in several major euro zone economies. The European Union is at the receiving end of tariffs introduced by U.S. President Donald Trump, including a 25% levy on imported cars.

germany.title: Trump's 200% tariffs could have an unlikely winner — troubled beer brewers
germany.content: U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to impose 200% tariffs on alcohol from Europe would serve a major blow to drinks makers on the continent. Such a levy, if enacted, could "literally wipe out" all global profits for some European drinks producers, Bernstein analyst Trevor Stirling told CNBC Friday.

germany.title: Dax Index News: Can the DAX Hold Gains After ECB Rate Cut and Trade Policy Shifts?
germany.content: DAX Rises on ECB Rate Cut, Fiscal Stimulus Hopes Grow – The ECB cuts rates while Germany considers fiscal easing. Will stimulus and trade shifts sustain DAX's record-breaking run?

china.title: Apple is welcome to expand investment in China, commerce minister tells CEO
china.content: China's commerce minister told Apple CEO Tim Cook on Monday that the company is welcome to expand investment in the country, a ministry statement showed.

china.title: Apple announces $99 million new clean energy fund in China
china.content: Apple Inc said on Monday it will set up a new clean energy fund in China worth 720 million yuan ($99.22 million), coinciding with a Beijing visit of its CEO Tim Cook.

china.title: Here's where Apple makes its products — and how Trump's tariffs could have an impact
china.content: Apple has made moves to diversify its supply chain beyond China to places like India and Vietnam, but tariffs announced by the White House are set to hit those countries too. President Donald Trump on Wednesday laid out U.S. "reciprocal tariff" rates on more than 180 countries.

china.title: Apple stock drops as investors weigh tariff impact
china.content: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL, ETR:APC) shares dropped 7.5% in premarket trading on Thursday as investors reacted to concerns over new US tariffs on Chinese imports. Analysts at Jefferies warn of a potential hit to the company's profits if exemptions are not granted.

china.title: Recession fears grow on Wall Street
china.content: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are falling as concerns grow over slowing economic growth following a tough week on Wall Street. Commentary from President Trump and ongoing trade tensions with China add to the uncertainty, especially with new tariffs on agricultural goods.

china.title: Apple Stock A Buy On 'Revenue Durability & Visibility': Analyst Highlights China Smartphone Sales Up In February
china.content: An Apple Inc AAPL analyst sees strong momentum for the company's smartphones in international markets, including China. The latest inventory checks and data could signal optimism for one of the areas that has weighed on Apple stock over the last year.

china.title: Apple Intelligence is not a major driver for an upgrade cycle, says Oppenheimer's Martin Yang
china.content: Martin Yang, Oppenheimer analyst, joins 'Money Movers' to discuss what led to the firm's downgrade of Apple, if things are different with Apple, and how to think about the brand's market share in China.

japan.title: Bank of Japan keeps rates steady as Trump tariffs cast a shadow over economic outlook
japan.content: Japan's central bank kept its key policy rate steady at 0.5% at Wednesday's conclusion of a two-day meeting. The move, which was in line with market expectations, comes as the Bank of Japan assesses the potential impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's protectionist trade policies on its export-reliant economy.

japan.title: Japanese stocks tumble as banks slump on tariff jitters
japan.content: Japanese stocks sank on Friday to their lowest levels since last August, and were set for their sharpest weekly drop in five years, as fears of a global recession in the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs gripped markets.

emerging_markets.title: Indonesia issues local content certificates for Apple products, including iPhone 16
emerging_markets.content: Indonesia has issued local content certificates for Apple products, including the iPhone 16 phones, a spokesperson for its industry ministry said on Friday, adding the company cannot sell the phones pending further procedures.

emerging_markets.title: Trump tariffs on Venezuela crude buyers are a potent new tool of US pressure
emerging_markets.content: A U.S. plan to slap tariffs on countries buying sanctioned Venezuelan oil marks an unprecedented, and potentially potent, mixture of punitive economic measures against a geopolitical foe that Washington could replicate against other countries like Russia and Iran, analysts said.

emerging_markets.title: Indonesia issues telco permit for some of Apple's iPhone 16 series
emerging_markets.content: Indonesia's communications ministry has issued a telecommunications permit for some of Apple's iPhone 16 series, according to the ministry's website.

emerging_markets.title: Apple step closer to seeing end of Indonesia iPhone sales ban
emerging_markets.content: Indonesia approved local certificates for more than a dozen Apple products on Friday, the industry ministry said, moving the tech giant a step closer to having a ban lifted on iPhone sales in Southeast Asia's biggest economy.

emerging_markets.title: Indian Stocks Are Over Their Slump. 2 Sectors to Consider.
emerging_markets.content: India's stock market is still the world's most expensive, but price-earnings ratios are back to historic averages. The financial and power sectors look attractive.

emerging_markets.title: Mexico tariffs paused, Bessent unworried by inflation
emerging_markets.content: President Donald Trump is reportedly pausing the 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada that went into effect Tuesday, March 4. The pause will last until April 2.

emerging_markets.title: Mexico now 'much more competitive' with Trump's far-reaching tariffs targeting Asia, says economist
emerging_markets.content: Cedric Chehab, chief economist at BMI, discusses U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to impose a raft of tariffs on key trade partners.

emerging_markets.title: Retailers' Stocks Melt Down on Tariffs. These Ones Are Holding Up.
emerging_markets.content: The so-called reciprocal tariffs on Vietnam and other Asian countries were worse than expected, and point to pain ahead for retailers.

global.title: Bitcoin Dominance Could Climb To 64%, Putting Altcoin Recovery In Jeopardy
global.content: As the world awaits US President Donald Trump's announcement on proposed retaliatory tariffs later today, crypto markets continue to show signs of uncertainty. In an X post shared earlier today, crypto analyst Rekt Capital emphasized that Bitcoin (BTC) dominance may be poised to rise further, potentially worsening conditions for altcoins, including Ethereum (ETH).

global.title: Wall Street futures sink as tariffs fuel recession fears
global.content: U.S. stock index futures tumbled on Thursday after President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs on major trade partners heightened fears of an all-out trade war that could push the global economy into a recession.

global.title: Global deal activity disappoints, M&A revenue falls as Trump pursues tariffs
global.content: A global trade war kicked off by U.S. President Donald Trump and the ensuing market turmoil soured bankers' predictions for a robust start to a blockbuster year for deals on Wall Street.

global.title: Oil set for worst week in months over Trump's new tariffs
global.content: Oil prices fell further in early Asian trade on Friday, and were on track for the worst week in months over U.S. President Donald Trump's new tariffs, stoking concerns over a global trade war that could weigh on oil demand.

global.title: Investors find auto motive for caution
global.content: Investors went on the defensive Thursday, reducing exposure to risky assets like stocks after U.S. President Donald Trump escalated the global trade wars with his plans to slap aggressive tariffs on auto imports from next week.

global.title: Trump widens trade war as he targets Venezuela's energy sector, eyes sectoral tariffs soon
global.content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday widened his global trade war with 25% secondary tariffs on any country that buys oil or gas from Venezuela, and said he would announce tariffs soon on automobiles, aluminum and pharmaceuticals.

global.title: Marine oil sales at key ports fall as global trade uncertainty brews
global.content: Sales of marine fuel at top global refuelling ports are slowing at the start of this year as the shipping sector grapples with uncertainty over geopolitics and the impact of escalating tariffs on global trade, industry sources said.

global.title: Trump blames ‘globalists' for stock market sell-off
global.content: President Donald Trump blamed "globalists" when asked why his tariffs appeared to be scaring the stock market. Major stock indices have dropped sharply this week, as rattled investors struggle to get a handle on Trump's trade policies.

global.title: 'WORST OF BOTH WORLDS': Expert warns inflation expectations have the Fed spooked
global.content: NatWest Markets U.S. Head Michelle Girard discusses the impact of tariffs on inflation and weighs the odds of a recession on 'Making Money.' #foxbusiness #makingmoney

global.title: Fed's Bostic on Inflation, Rate Cuts and Tariffs
global.content: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic discusses the outlook for Fed monetary policy, the US labor market and the economic impact of tariffs with Mike McKee on Bloomberg Television. Sign up for the Economics Daily newsletter to discover what's driving the global economy and what it means for policy makers, businesses, investors and you: https://bloom.bg/4535pfS -------- More on Bloomberg Television and Markets Like this video?

global.title: Apple to hold Worldwide Developers Conference from June 9
global.content: Apple will hold its Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) from June 9 to June 13, it said on Tuesday.

global.title: JP Morgan analysts say recession risk increased to 60% since Trump announced tariffs: 'There will be blood'
global.content: JP Morgan analysts told clients that Trump's tariff plan will have drastic economic effects. The risk of the global economy falling into a recession has increased from 40% to 60%, they warned.

global.title: PIMCO's Richard Clarida: Recession is not baseline case, but odds have gone up due to uncertainty
global.content: Richard Clarida, PIMCO global economic advisor and former vice chairman at the Fed, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss how today's tariff announcement could change economic outlooks, why he believes American exceptionalism will prevail, and more.

global.title: Part 2: This Is Not A Recessionary Bear Market
global.content: Recent forecasts for a recession and bear market in 2025 are misguided; real-world economic indicators show less severe damage than sentiment suggests. Trump's tariffs and austerity measures are temporary headwinds; expected rollbacks and Fed rate cuts should offset negative impacts on the economy.

global.title: Apple Leads Premarket Slide In Tech Stocks As Trump's Reciprocal Tariffs Trigger Global Selloff
global.content: U.S. futures indexes fell sharply early on Thursday, led by a deep slide in major tech stocks, while global markets also faced a major selloff after President Donald Trump's sweeping reciprocal tariffs raised fears of a global trade war and recession.

global.title: How Cheap Are Big Tech Stocks?
global.content: The US stock market is currently experiencing one of its sharpest corrections in recent history, driven by uncertainty around trade policy and declining economic growth forecasts. President Donald Trump's frequent shifts in international tariff rhetoric have left businesses and investors navigating a rapidly changing landscape.
